heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 13 October 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 1.9°C) and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.2°C), cloud levels (up 394 m), and inside temperature (up 2.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 92.4m higher than yesterday, 120.9m lower than the past week, 393.8m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 926m and a peak of 1357m, averaging 1177.5m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures may feel cool outdoors. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and the light is absent. Stable weather patterns due to high pressure.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
